main event: A ball-shaped, greenish-yellow, extremely brilliant object was sighted in the vicinity of Midway Island on June 25, 1960.
interesting points: The object was traveling at extremely high speed and disappeared approximately 15 degrees above the horizon, separating into two pieces immediately prior to burnout.
The intensity of the light increased steadily until burnout.
The object was observed for 5-8 seconds by the pilots, who stated it was unlike any shooting star they had previously seen.
The weather conditions were clear with good visibility, and the sighting was confirmed by the pilots' position relative to the ship on TACAN.
The pilot had 24 months of experience, and the co-pilot had 5 months of experience.
photographs: No photographs were included in the report
